sub_title: Senior System Engineer at  Ignite BOP Limited
summary:
My name is Robert Ryan and I possess a multifaceted technical career with 15+ years’ track record of innovation in network administration. Throughout my career, I have gained broad exposure of configuring network infrastructure, improving network availability and performance, and providing support to end users. 

I possess solid understanding of networking with an emphasis on Cisco routers and switches. I am an engaging and articulate communicator with ability to clearly convey complex technical information and propose novel solutions to build consensus with key project stakeholders, including high-value clients and executive leadership. Furthermore, my consistent focus on remaining at the forefront of rapidly evolving technology allows me to drive enterprise-wide innovation and maintain a competitive advantage.

My expertise in improving network availability and performance and my passion for using networks to improve business efficiency positions me to greatly impact any high-growth organisation.

Following are some of the highlights of my career:

☛ Provided active on call 24 hours’ services throughout my time in Eir, supporting both the Wan and Web Hosting Environment.

☛ Obtained recertification of Cisco CCNP despite having limited access to a managed Network by Accenture; CCNP Certified, recertified three times through MPLS, Troubleshooting and Routing Courses to provide strong 1st and 2nd line support to business areas in an outsourced managed environment.

☛ Implemented Management and Monitoring Solution in Eir with products like Ciscoworks, HP Open View & WhatUp within organisation; key player in roll out of Patrol Management system.  

While others take pride in meeting all standards set before them, my passion is for delivering service that goes beyond organizational expectations, creating a win-win scenario for everyone involved!

location.default: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand

profile_positions.location: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand
profile_positions.description: Working as senior System Engineer managing and providing solutions to  Local Clients.
profile_positions.title: Senior System Engineer

profile_positions.description: Working as part of the EMEA, Lan & WLAN team support Solvay Global Network. Responsible for modernization of Cisco Switches,  troubleshoot any ticket, manage new requests for both LAN and WLC and AP's.
profile_positions.title: Network Engineer

profile_positions.description:
In this capacity, I oversee the responsibility of monitoring and assessing situation in disaster recovery sites in IBM on regular basis. I manage and support high-level local firewall infrastructure, including Cisco ASA and Checkpoints. 

I collaborate with internal and external stakeholders and teams to troubleshoot network issues and introduce effective approaches to optimize performance of network infrastructure. I examine criteria of request in Allianz Area and approve local and inter country change management requests for implementing required changes within organisation.

Related Skills: IBM Troubleshooting / Issue Resolution, Firewall Infrastructure Management, Stakeholder Relationship Management, Performance Improvement Initiatives, Change Management and Implementation 

Following are some of the highlights of the value I brought to Allianz:

☛ Spearheaded the development of high-quality voice infrastructure, maintenance, and data support in headquarters and branch offices in collaboration with network teams.

☛ Earned recognition and praise from senior management for supporting and resolving complex issues of 24 hours working critical call centres related with third party Allianz companies Darta Systems and Allianz Worldwide Care.  

☛ Acted as a local expert and utilised onsite knowledge for the smooth implementation of new and effective migration solutions.

☛ Played an instrumental role in analysing business requirements and providing recommendations, while working with Global Partners and other Allianz operational units.  
☛ Ensured the provision of 2nd line support to the business in a busy and highly critical contact centre environment.
profile_positions.title: Network Manager

profile_positions.description:
In this capacity, I utilised extensive technical experience and expertise for designing and establishing Network Management Suite to inspect network performance, capacity planning, and critical components checking for network operations centre staff.

Related Skills: Network Architecture Development, Network Performance / Efficiency, Capacity Planning, Network Operations Staff Management

Following are some of the highlights of the value I brought to Eircom:

☛ Achieved customer satisfaction through delivery of excellent services to web-hosting customers by resolving all issues on time.

☛ Gained extensive technical exposure by working on multiple technologies, such as STP, EIGRP, OSPF, QOS, and BGP.

☛ Spearheaded the development and implementation of advanced technologies within business for enhancing work efficiency and reliability of corporate WAN; key member of Eircom WAN Team for supporting and maintaining the eircom National WAN.
Worked as part of the Wide Area Network team managing the Eircom Network in Ireland. We were responsible for capacity planning, level 2 support, network management. We also had a number of customers in our web hosting environment was part of a team of 5 people who was on call 24 a day rota
profile_positions.title: Network Administrator

volunteer_experiences.description: I have a member of the club for 30 years. I have held the role of Assistant Treasurer, Handicap Secretary and Assistant Secretary. I write newsletters for the club, I worked on book for our 50th anniversary and looked after the ordering / distribution of merchandise for the 50th year, dealing with Sports Companies. I deal with local design companies re signage on the course and our six sponsors of championships within the club. I also sponsor the Player of the year championship. I have held position as PRO within the club and on the Dublin County Board, penning article for local papers, updating our website and carrying out radio interviews
